subject: Language Arts
title: Convince Me! The Art of Persuasive Writing
learningObjectives: Define persuasive writing and understand its purpose.
Structure a persuasive argument with an introduction, reasons, and a conclusion.

content.body: Persuasive writing is used to convince, or persuade, a reader to believe an idea or to take a specific action. It's all about making a strong argument!

content.alt: An icon of a person giving a speech with a speech bubble.

content.body: A good persuasive piece includes a clear opinion, strong reasons to support that opinion, and facts or evidence to back up those reasons. A popular structure to remember this is OREO: Opinion, Reason, Evidence, Opinion (restated).

questions.question: What is the main purpose of persuasive writing?
options: To entertain the reader with a story
To inform the reader about a topic
To convince the reader of an opinion
questions.correctAnswer: To convince the reader of an opinion

questions.question: Which of the following is a FACT, not an opinion?
options: The Earth revolves around the Sun.
questions.correctAnswer: The Earth revolves around the Sun.

es.title: ¡Convénceme! El Arte de la Escritura Persuasiva

content.body: La escritura persuasiva se usa para convencer, o persuadir, a un lector para que crea una idea o tome una acción específica. ¡Se trata de hacer un argumento fuerte!

questions.question: ¿Cuál es el propósito principal de la escritura persuasiva?
options: Entretener al lector con una historia
Informar al lector sobre un tema
Convencer al lector de una opinión

questions.question: ¿Cuál de los siguientes es un HECHO, no una opinión?
options: La pizza es la mejor comida.
La Tierra gira alrededor del Sol.
El recreo debería ser más largo.
